All bets were now off.  This meant that whoever did not have their weapons =
could gladly take them up again. Yet, Tucson was actually content just figh=
ting unarmed, since his ninjabot training taught him how to defend himself =
with only his hands, arms, feet and legs.  Night Shift too, was highly adep=
t at this fighting style, yet Straight Shot was far more content by activat=
ing her own on board weaponry to step in for an assist where she was needed=
.  She quickly saw that Kup needed some help, and quickly darts in, with a =
leap attack to attempt a rapid fire arrow assault on Phobia.

"No worries K=
up, I gotchya!  EAT THIS YA PLANE BRAIN WENCH!"

Meanwhile, Tucson's injure=
d arm hinders him fully from using the full benefit of his ninjabot trainin=
g, yet tries hard to compensate for the loss of that limb, by moving a bit =
faster on his feet, positioning his good arm to defend himself.  He also ta=
kes this quick moment to think for a moment, as strategy was another one of=
 his fortes.  Then it suddenly comes to him.  His sonar system, it was stil=
l working at full capacity.  But he would have to emit a signal more deafen=
ing than anything he had ever emitted before.  And this time, there was no =
time to configure it so it would not hinder the Maximals or the Autobots.  =
So, heavilly encrypted to all Autobots and Maximals, he sends another messa=
ge.

"Attention, all Maximals, and Autobots, the only solution I see to slo=
wing our enemy down, is to emit a sonar signal that is ten times stronger t=
han any of the signals I've ever emitted before.  I am capable of it, but h=
ave refrained due to a fear of harming you.  There is no time for me to con=
figure the signal, so I ask all of you now, to disable your audio receptors=
 to keep them from being harmed.  I will emit this signal T minus thirty se=
conds.  You have just that enough of time to cut off your receptors to keep=
 them from harm.  This is my first attempt at this tactic, and I am not sur=
e as to the outcome.  I ask all of you to bare with me, and to trust that t=
his will slow the attack long enough to gain an advantage."

Night Shift an=
d Straight Shot quickly do as instructed.  It was now up to Tucson to execu=
te his tactic.

Meanwhile, at the black fortress, Rat Trap also recieves Tu=
cson's message, and nodds.  He looks to Windlord, as he now faces the ugly =
little spider droids in the pipes.

" Aww geeze, I dunno if thirty seconds =
is enough time ta save our tail ends... Now what?  Spiders can go anywhere =
we can go..  I know...  Follow my lead Windlord, I got an idea."

Playing p=
ossum was one of the oldest tricks in the book, and Rat Trap hoped it would=
 get them both out of that bind.  He starts to act as if having been poison=
ed by something, and collapses onto his side, breating ever so slowly, as i=
f dying from intoxication.  He hoped that Windlord would follow his lead, a=
nd hope that this would get those ugly little arachnids off their backs.

A=
t the Ark, Quickstride and Uproar listen to Rodimus carefully.  Although no=
t the brightest bots on the force, they had enough know how to hold their o=
wn in tough situations. 

Uproar raises a paw.

"Hey, I think I have anothe=
r idea ta help that one along Rodimus.  The shield around the ark, does tha=
t only work above ground or underground too?  Because if it doesn't work un=
derground, I could burrow a tunnel beneath the ark, and come above ground n=
ear an alternative entrance, if it has one.  With your scrambling devices, =
and my ability ta dig under ground, we could get in without much of a fuss.=
  Whoever's out there wouldn't even know we're on the move."  I know how ta=
 dig without making noise."

Quickstride nodds.

"Hey, and while he does th=
at, I could show myself, and create a distraction long enough for you guys =
ta get in.  We're not the most brilliant of the maximals, but we know the b=
asics."

Inside the walls the spider like Predacons continued their chase, the

nous sounds of their metal legs hitting the walls creating a rapid

licking sound as they pursued Rat Trap and Windlord. Four of

rk, past a

y all moved out of sight of the Ark and moved

eral large rocks and trees. As he walked he

to us... so far I watched... "

He said he has been loyal

over heard. He carefully held up a small device. "But this is what

k will get us in."

given me a

around

ng

s, not sure what to make of what he was

ten.

obviously mistrustful. "It scrambles spark signatures not force

set to recognize certain spark signatures, it is just being held in

ride mode right now." Rodimus pulled out one more device, a small

onverter. "I believe I can disrupt the shield in a small

to create a doorway that would allow us to enter."
>

ghtened in recognition, "I see. You can play with

gnition parameters." He smiled ruefully, "It
> wouldn't bring down the whol=
e shield, but it would allow us to run
> through before it closed on us aga=
in."

> Wing Caliber nodded as well, "You do know the shield will adjust =
to it
> after that."
